individual_metadata.synopsis: Cerys, a tiefling scout, is now present in Last Light along with the others who evaded capture by the cultists. She has reluctantly assumed the role of leader in Zevlor's absence (assuming she hadn't already). She's exhausted by the responisibility but still capable of a little gallows humour.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug Book, choose Tiefling Path.Speak to Cerys at the Last Light Inn, (-63; 27; 144)

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The input only contains one session (with an empty string as the key) and there are no indicators in its synopsis or trigger conditions that imply a dependency on another session or any mutual exclusiveness constraints. Therefore, no ordering or exclusiveness rules can be derived from this data.

10.speaker: Cerys
10.text: We're bruised, battered... but we're together again. You damn well brought them back.

11.speaker: Cerys
11.text: I promised you a drink the next time we met. This inn isn't what I had in mind.
11.context: NodeContext: Smiling, happy to see us, but muted. She's suffered tragedy since we last saw her.

8.speaker: Cerys
8.text: I owe you an apology. You pulled my people from one death-trap, only for me to land them in another.
8.context: NodeContext: Growing serious - in her mind, she messed up the chance we gave her

31.speaker: Player
31.text: What the hells happened? Where is everyone?

80.speaker: Player
80.text: 'Death-trap'? I've slept in worse inns, trust me.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: How did you blunder into danger this time?

66.speaker: Cerys
66.context: NodeContext: A little stiff - primed to take offense but relaxes, accepts the insult is probably warranted

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I prefer setting traps over walking into them - what happened?

15.speaker: Cerys
15.text: Thought you'd be ten yards tall, the way my people speak of you.
15.context: NodeContext: Blunt, eyeing us up (friendly, not unimpressed - but muted due to circumstances)

34.speaker: Cerys
34.text: Thought you'd be ten yards tall, the way Zevlor spoke of you.
34.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: Blunt, eyeing us up (friendly, not unimpressed - but muted due to circumstances)

71.speaker: Cerys
71.text: Cerys. Scout. Seems we missed one another at the grove, but the others told me how you helped us.

85.speaker: Cerys
85.text: A pity. You pulled them from one death-trap only for me to land them in this one.
85.context: NodeContext: Sighing, looking around at the inn. She's exhausted and guilty in equal measure.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Rolan said his siblings were taken. What happened out there?

83.speaker: Cerys
83.text: Aye. Don't blame him for drinking this place dry.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I heard you were ambushed by the cult. It sounded brutal.

89.speaker: Cerys
89.text: Aye. Not a battle she's likely to put to song. Maybe we should have just surrendered - Zevlor begged us to. But...

50.speaker: Cerys
50.text: Aye. Not a battle she's likely to put to song. Maybe we should have just surrendered, but...

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I heard you were ambushed by the cult. It sounded brutal.

75.speaker: Cerys
75.text: Aye - brutal is putting it lightly. Maybe we should have just surrendered - Zevlor begged us to. But...

19.speaker: Cerys
19.text: Aye - brutal is putting it lightly. Maybe we should have just surrendered, but...

100.speaker: Cerys
100.text: Gone, and more than half the others with him.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I don't see Zevlor. Don't tell me he's missing aswell?

95.speaker: Cerys
95.text: Aye, and more than half the others with him.

40.speaker: Cerys
40.text: We were ambushed out in the cursed lands - cultists of this Absolute. Zevlor froze, begged us to surrender, but...

78.speaker: Cerys
78.text: They were toying with us. Making examples. And we'd had enough of taking it.

55.speaker: Cerys
55.text: Those of us who cut free just kept running 'til we found this place. The others... maybe the cult got them. Maybe the curse.
55.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, helpless. It's not that she doesn't care what happened to them, but she's exhausted and knows there's little she can do

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Have hope. You survived - I'm sure the others did too.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: You did right. You do not want to be a prisoner of the Absolute.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: What are you doing out here to begin with? You were bound for Baldur's Gate.

42.speaker: Cerys
42.text: This army of the Absolute is growing, and flowing towards Moonrise. There's worse than goblins on the roads now.
42.context: NodeContext: Ominous, frustrated. They met much more resistance than she imagined

24.speaker: Cerys
24.text: I thought we might pass unnoticed along the fringes of this place. Escape the owlbear by hiding in its shadow, so to speak.

25.speaker: Cerys
25.text: You can see exactly how well that went.
25.context: NodeContext: Making light of her own foolish plan. Not jokey, just tired - her failure is self-evident

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Don't lose hope. The others might still be alive.

41.speaker: Cerys
41.text: Zevlor had hope. It didn't save him. A little sense will serve us better, I think.
41.context: NodeContext: Not overly forceful, just refusing to be swayed from the grim reality. Small sigh.

98.speaker: Cerys
98.text: But... thanks. It was sweet of you try.
98.context: NodeContext: Small smile. She's not one for sweetness, but finds our sheer unearned optimism endearing.

91.speaker: Cerys
91.text: The time for hoping is past. I've got to get what's left of us to the city.
91.context: NodeContext: Not overly forceful, just refusing to be swayed from the grim reality. Small sigh.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Sounds like you made a right mess of things.

3.speaker: Cerys
3.text: Aye, I did. Maybe you'd have been the one to save us all, if you'd been there.
3.context: NodeContext: No pretense - she openly accepts she abandoned some people, but has to be pragmatic.

45.speaker: Cerys
45.text: Or maybe you'd be missing along with the rest.
45.context: NodeContext: Stark - not trying to provoke or insult us, just stating facts

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Still, you're here. Better than being a prisoner of the Absolute.

94.speaker: Cerys
94.text: Prison's the best I can hope for the ones we left behind. Zevlor seemed to think the cult wanted us alive.

47.speaker: Cerys
47.text: I almost hope he never found out why.
47.context: NodeContext: Vaguely shuddering at the thought of what the cult would need prisoners for

58.speaker: Cerys
58.text: Prison's the best I can hope for the ones we left behind. This cult seemed to want us alive.

57.speaker: Cerys
57.text: I almost hope the others never found out why.
57.context: NodeContext: Vaguely shuddering at the thought of what the cult would need prisoners for

46.speaker: Player
46.text: To despair is fruitless. To hope is divine - do not give up.

48.speaker: Cerys
48.text: Hope? You would bid me hope?

53.speaker: Cerys
53.text: We've no brighter horizon ahead of us. There's just the city - if I can get us there alive.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You didn't stand your ground? You deserted your allies? Disgraceful.

7.speaker: Cerys
7.text: Heroism is no comfort to the dead.
7.context: NodeContext: a touch sharp, she's not annoyed, more surprised the player would be so naive

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Do you think the cult planned this? Or was it a surprise attack?

87.speaker: Cerys
87.text: It's hard to tell. We were alone in the darkness one moment, surrounded the next.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You let your fear conquer you. Be careful not to let your life be ruled by it.

76.speaker: Cerys
76.text: We're in a dilapidated inn, surrounded by cursed darkness - only a fool wouldn't be afraid.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Have you no shame? You were tasked with protecting these people, yet you ran.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Your life is your own - you owe these people nothing. You were right to run.

51.speaker: Cerys
51.text: We were ambushed out in the cursed lands - cultists of this Absolute. Likely we should have surrendered, but...

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I don't see Zevlor. Don't tell me he's missing aswell?

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I don't see Zevlor. Don't tell me he's missing aswell?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: The inn is old, but 'death-trap' is a bit much.

35.speaker: Cerys
35.text: Glad you've kept your humour. The others could use it - what's left of us.
35.context: NodeContext: Smiling at our joke - less at the content than the fact we can joke at all.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: So you managed to miss all that trouble at the grove. Convenient.

26.speaker: Cerys
26.text: I was trying to scout a path for us while you got busy carving one. But don't worry, I've had my fill of fighting since.
26.context: NodeContext: wry, but ending on a somber note

37.speaker: Cerys
37.text: Seems not everyone made it out of that tower. But it'd be none at all with you - thank you. Truly.
37.context: NodeContext: A little mournful, but still grateful

59.speaker: Cerys
59.text: Watch your back out there. If it's not the cult coming for you, it'll be the shadows.
59.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.

67.speaker: Cerys
67.text: I looked for Zevlor among those who came back. No matter his fate... I know he'd be grateful to you. I am too.
67.context: NodeContext: A little mournful, but still grateful

73.speaker: Cerys
73.text: Glad to see you again. I was afraid you'd get swallowed up by the shadows. Instead, you've found us some cavalry. Very well done.

86.speaker: Cerys
86.text: You've the look of someone with news. Good or bad?

68.speaker: Cerys
68.text: I'll make sure the others know you tried, but nothing's changed.
68.context: NodeContext: Trying to set grief aside.

44.speaker: Cerys
44.text: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and what's left of us is damn well getting there.
44.context: NodeContext: Fierce - she won't let any more die

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I tried, but your people didn't make it out of Moonrise. I'm sorry.

92.speaker: Cerys
92.text: Sorry for what? Doing more for them than I did?
92.context: NodeContext: Quiet anger and sorrow, but not directed at us

93.speaker: Cerys
93.text: I'll catch up with you later. I have some... funeral rites to prepare.
93.context: NodeContext: Bracing herself for a sad task - just heard of the deaths of her friends

96.speaker: Cerys
96.text: This place has been buzzing with talk of an adventurer who found us an angel. Sounds like salvation to me, don't you think?

99.speaker: Cerys
99.text: The end's in sight. I can feel it.
